meanings.definition: A person who jots down notes or ideas.
meanings.sent1: The jotter quickly wrote down the important points from the meeting.
meanings.sent2: I always keep a jotter handy to jot down any interesting thoughts that come to mind.
meanings.sent3: The jotter in the class was known for having the neatest handwriting.
meanings.sent4: She was a human jotter, always remembering every detail of every conversation.
meanings.sent5: The diligent jotter never missed a single detail in his notes.

meanings.definition: A small notebook or pad for writing brief notes.
meanings.sent1: I grabbed my jotter to jot down the grocery items I needed to buy.
meanings.sent2: The jotter in my bag is perfect for jotting quick reminders throughout the day.
meanings.sent3: The tiny jotter was filled with doodles and scribbles from the boring lecture.
meanings.sent4: Her jotter was like a treasure trove of memories and important information.
meanings.sent5: The colorful jotter stood out among the sea of plain notebooks.

meanings.definition: To write or record something quickly or briefly.
meanings.sent1: She had to jotter down the phone number before she forgot it.
meanings.sent2: I always jotter my ideas on a piece of paper to keep track of them.
meanings.sent3: He tried to jotter the main points of the lecture but ended up missing most of it.
meanings.sent4: The writer would jotter down his dreams as soon as he woke up.
meanings.sent5: In a rush, she would jotter down her thoughts before they slipped away.
